title: Pixar's 'Elio' is emblematic of a bigger headwind for Hollywood
summary: Disney and Pixar's "Elio" had a record low opening for the studio, but its performance is emblematic of a much wider trend in Hollywood: a reliance on sequels.
aiSummary: Disney and Pixar's latest film, "Elio," opened to disappointing numbers at the box office, marking a record low for the studio. This underwhelming performance reflects a broader issue in the film industry, where sequels have become the go-to strategy for many studios. The reliance on sequels has raised concerns about creativity and originality in Hollywood. Despite the challenges, "Elio" serves as a reminder of the importance of taking creative risks in an industry dominated by familiar franchises.

title: PayPal teams up with the Big Ten and Big 12 to enable payments to student-athletes

title: Trump administration moves to count crypto as a federal mortgage asset
summary: The Trump administration is ordering Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to formally consider cryptocurrency as an asset in single-family mortgage loan risk assessments.
aiSummary: In a groundbreaking move, the Trump administration has directed Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to include cryptocurrency as a potential asset in their evaluations of single-family mortgage loan risks. This decision reflects the growing acceptance and popularity of cryptocurrencies in the financial sector. By recognizing cryptocurrency as a legitimate asset class, the administration is responding to the evolving financial landscape and adapting traditional lending practices to accommodate the changing preferences of borrowers. This development underscores the importance of staying abreast of emerging trends in the market and adapting business practices accordingly to remain competitive and relevant in today's dynamic financial environment.

title: China urges Beijing-backed development bank to focus more on Belt and Road Initiative
summary: Chinese Premier Li Qiang called on the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to increase its support for Beijing's Belt and Road Initiative.
aiSummary: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang has urged the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to boost its backing for China's Belt and Road Initiative. This initiative, aimed at promoting infrastructure development and connectivity across Asia, has been a key priority for the Chinese government. Li's call for increased support from the AIIB underscores the importance of the initiative for China's economic and geopolitical goals. As the AIIB plays a crucial role in financing infrastructure projects in the region, its alignment with the Belt and Road Initiative is seen as a significant step towards achieving China's strategic objectives. This development highlights the growing influence of China in shaping regional infrastructure development and underscores the need for businesses to monitor and potentially participate in projects under the Belt and Road Initiative to capitalize on emerging opportunities in the region.
